maml:description.maml:para: Receive HL7 v2.x messages via a TCP connection (MLLP).
Receives a HL7 v2.x message via a TCP connection (MLLP framing).
The path to store the messages received. Must be a literal Path.
The the TCP port to listen for messages on.
The timeout in seconds before idle connections are dropped (defaults to 60 seconds if not specified).
Set the text encoding. Supports "UTF-8" or "ISO-8859-1" (Western European). Defaults to "UTF-8" if parameter not supplied.
Do not send an acknowledgement (ACK) message.
The path to store the messages received. Must be a literal Path.
The the TCP port to listen for messages on.
The timeout in seconds before idle connections are dropped (defaults to 60 seconds if not specified).
Set the text encoding. Supports "UTF-8" or "ISO-8859-1" (Western European). Defaults to "UTF-8" if parameter not supplied.
Do not send an acknowledgement (ACK) message.
Remove personal identifiers for patients and next of kin from HL7 files.
Removes names, addresses and other personally identifiable details from a HL7 v2.x Message.
By default a new file is saved in the same location as the original file with "MASKED_" prefixed to the file name. If the optional "-OverwriteFile" switch is set the original file will be modified.
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.

A list of the HL7 items to mask instead of the default segments and fields. List each item in a comma separated list (no spaces). Items can include a mix of segments (e.g. PV1), Fields (e.g. PID-3), Components (e.g. "PID-3.1") or Subcomponents (e.g. "PV1-42.2.2"). For repeating segments and fields a specific repeat can be identified (index starts at 1). e.g. "PID-3[1].1" will mask out the first occurrence of "PID-3.1", leaving other repeats of "PID-3.1" unchanged. Likewise "IN1[2]" will mask out the second occurrence of the IN1 segments only. e.g.
-CustomItemsList PID-3.1,PID-5,PID-13,NK1
The character used to mask the identifier fields, Defaults to '*' if not supplied.
If this switch is set, the original file is modified.

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory, or a list of files. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provide, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.

A list of the HL7 items to mask instead of the default segments and fields. List each item in a comma separated list (no spaces). Items can include a mix of segments (e.g. PV1), Fields (e.g. PID-3), Components (e.g. "PID-3.1") or Subcomponents (e.g. "PV1-42.2.2"). For repeating segments and fields a specific repeat can be identified (index starts at 1). e.g. "PID-3[1].1" will mask out the first occurrence of "PID-3.1", leaving other repeats of "PID-3.1" unchanged. Likewise "IN1[2]" will mask out the second occurrence of the IN1 segments only. e.g.
-CustomItemsList PID-3.1,PID-5,PID-13,NK1
The character used to mask the identifier fields, Defaults to '*' if not supplied.
If this switch is set, the original file is modified.
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.

A list of the HL7 items to mask instead of the default segments and fields. List each item in a comma separated list (no spaces). Items can include a mix of segments (e.g. PV1), Fields (e.g. PID-3), Components (e.g. "PID-3.1") or Subcomponents (e.g. "PV1-42.2.2"). For repeating segments and fields a specific repeat can be identified (index starts at 1). e.g. "PID-3[1].1" will mask out the first occurrence of "PID-3.1", leaving other repeats of "PID-3.1" unchanged. Likewise "IN1[2]" will mask out the second occurrence of the IN1 segments only. e.g.
-CustomItemsList PID-3.1,PID-5,PID-13,NK1
The character used to mask the identifier fields, Defaults to '*' if not supplied.
If this switch is set, the original file is modified.

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory, or a list of files. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provide, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.
Delete the value for a nominated item in the HL7 message.
Deletes the value of specified items from the HL7 message. A list of items, or single item can be specified.
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
A string identifying the location of the item in the HL7 message you wish to retrieve the value for. e.g.

PID Identifies the PID Segment PID-3 Identifies the PID-3 Field PID-3.1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component PID-3.1.1 Identifies the PID-3.1.1 Subcomponent PID-3[2].1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component for second occurrence of the PID-3 Field

Only includes messages where a HL7 item equals a specific value. The format is: HL7Item=value. The HL7Item part of the filter is of the same format as the -ItemPosition parameter. The -Filter parameter accepts a list of filters (separated by a comma). If a list of filters is provided then a message must match all conditions to be included. e.g.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05 This filter would only include messages that had "ADT^A05" as the value for the MSH-9 field.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05,PV1-2=OUTPATIENT This filter would only include messages where both the MSH-9 field contained "ADT^A04" and the PV1-2 field contained "OUTPATIENT"
Delete all repeats identified, Defaults to only deleting the first occurrence if this switch is not set.

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provide, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.
A string identifying the location of the item in the HL7 message you wish to retrieve the value for. e.g.

PID Identifies the PID Segment PID-3 Identifies the PID-3 Field PID-3.1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component PID-3.1.1 Identifies the PID-3.1.1 Subcomponent PID-3[2].1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component for second occurrence of the PID-3 Field

Only includes messages where a HL7 item equals a specific value. The format is: HL7Item=value. The HL7Item part of the filter is of the same format as the -ItemPosition parameter. The -Filter parameter accepts a list of filters (separated by a comma). If a list of filters is provided then a message must match all conditions to be included. e.g.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05 This filter would only include messages that had "ADT^A05" as the value for the MSH-9 field.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05,PV1-2=OUTPATIENT This filter would only include messages where both the MSH-9 field contained "ADT^A04" and the PV1-2 field contained "OUTPATIENT"
Delete all repeats identified, Defaults to only deleting the first occurrence if this switch is not set.
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
A string identifying the location of the item in the HL7 message you wish to retrieve the value for. e.g.

PID Identifies the PID Segment PID-3 Identifies the PID-3 Field PID-3.1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component PID-3.1.1 Identifies the PID-3.1.1 Subcomponent PID-3[2].1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component for second occurrence of the PID-3 Field

Only includes messages where a HL7 item equals a specific value. The format is: HL7Item=value. The HL7Item part of the filter is of the same format as the -ItemPosition parameter. The -Filter parameter accepts a list of filters (separated by a comma). If a list of filters is provided then a message must match all conditions to be included. e.g.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05 This filter would only include messages that had "ADT^A05" as the value for the MSH-9 field.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05,PV1-2=OUTPATIENT This filter would only include messages where both the MSH-9 field contained "ADT^A04" and the PV1-2 field contained "OUTPATIENT"
Delete all repeats identified, Defaults to only deleting the first occurrence if this switch is not set.

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provide, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.
Queries a HL7 file (or list of files) to return a specific HL7 Item.

This CmdLet returns the values of specific HL7 items from a file (or group of files). This is intended to aid with integration work to validate the values of fields over a large sample of HL7 messages. Some basic filtering is available to include specific messages from a larger sample.
Output can be piped to other PowerShell CmdLets to refine the results. e.g. returning only the unique values across a range of files:
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
A string identifying the location of the item in the HL7 message you wish to retrieve the value for. e.g.

PID Identifies the PID Segment PID-3 Identifies the PID-3 Field PID-3.1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component PID-3.1.1 Identifies the PID-3.1.1 Subcomponent PID-3[2].1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component for second occurrence of the PID-3 Field

Only includes messages where a HL7 item equals a specific value. The format is: HL7Item=value. The HL7Item part of the filter is of the same format as the -ItemPosition parameter. The -Filter parameter accepts a list of filters (separated by a comma). If a list of filters is provided then a message must match all conditions to be included. e.g.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05 This filter would only include messages that had "ADT^A05" as the value for the MSH-9 field.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05,PV1-2=OUTPATIENT This filter would only include messages where both the MSH-9 field contained "ADT^A04" and the PV1-2 field contained "OUTPATIENT"

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provided, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.
A string identifying the location of the item in the HL7 message you wish to retrieve the value for. e.g.

PID Identifies the PID Segment PID-3 Identifies the PID-3 Field PID-3.1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component PID-3.1.1 Identifies the PID-3.1.1 Subcomponent PID-3[2].1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component for second occurrence of the PID-3 Field

Only includes messages where a HL7 item equals a specific value. The format is: HL7Item=value. The HL7Item part of the filter is of the same format as the -ItemPosition parameter. The -Filter parameter accepts a list of filters (separated by a comma). If a list of filters is provided then a message must match all conditions to be included. e.g.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05 This filter would only include messages that had "ADT^A05" as the value for the MSH-9 field.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05,PV1-2=OUTPATIENT This filter would only include messages where both the MSH-9 field contained "ADT^A04" and the PV1-2 field contained "OUTPATIENT"
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
A string identifying the location of the item in the HL7 message you wish to retrieve the value for. e.g.

PID Identifies the PID Segment PID-3 Identifies the PID-3 Field PID-3.1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component PID-3.1.1 Identifies the PID-3.1.1 Subcomponent PID-3[2].1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component for second occurrence of the PID-3 Field

Only includes messages where a HL7 item equals a specific value. The format is: HL7Item=value. The HL7Item part of the filter is of the same format as the -ItemPosition parameter. The -Filter parameter accepts a list of filters (separated by a comma). If a list of filters is provided then a message must match all conditions to be included. e.g.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05 This filter would only include messages that had "ADT^A05" as the value for the MSH-9 field.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05,PV1-2=OUTPATIENT This filter would only include messages where both the MSH-9 field contained "ADT^A04" and the PV1-2 field contained "OUTPATIENT"

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provided, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Display the Patient ID values for all hl7 files in c:\test
Pipe all files with .hl7 extensions to the CmdLet, return Patient ID values.
Display all PID-5 values where the value of PV1-2 is INPATIENT.

maml:description.maml:para: Send a HL7 file to a remote host via TCP (MLLP).
Send a HL7 v2.x message from a file (or list of files) via TCP to a remote endpoint. Messages are framed using MLLP (Minimal Lower Layer Protocol).
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
The IP Address or host name of the remote host to send the HL7 message to.
The TCP port of the listener on the remote host to send the HL7 message to.
This switch instructs the CmdLet not to wait for an ACK response from the remote host.
The delay (in seconds) between sending each message.
Set the text encoding. Supports "UTF-8" or "ISO-8859-1" (Western European). Defaults to "UTF-8" if parameter not supplied.

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provide, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ',' (no spaces).
The IP Address or host name of the remote host to send the HL7 message to.
The TCP port of the listener on the remote host to send the HL7 message to.
This switch instructs the CmdLet not to wait for an ACK response from the remote host.
The delay (in seconds) between sending each message.
Set the text encoding. Supports "UTF-8" or "ISO-8859-1" (Western European). Defaults to "UTF-8" if parameter not supplied.
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
The IP Address or host name of the remote host to send the HL7 message to.
The TCP port of the listener on the remote host to send the HL7 message to.
This switch instructs the CmdLet not to wait for an ACK response from the remote host.
The delay (in seconds) between sending each message.
Set the text encoding. Supports "UTF-8" or "ISO-8859-1" (Western European). Defaults to "UTF-8" if parameter not supplied.

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provide, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ',' (no spaces).

dev:remarks.maml:para: Send all .hl7 files in the c:\HL7Files folder. Use ISO-8859-1 (Wester European) text encoding.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the value of an existing item within a HL7 file.

This CmdLet changes the value of an existing HL7 item from a file (or group of files). Some basic filtering is available to only include specific messages within a large sample. By default only the first occurrence of an item will be changed unless the -UpdateAllRepeats switch is set. Items that cannot be located in the message will display a warning. To suppress the warning messages use the "-WarningAction Ignore" common parameter.
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
A string identifying the location of the item in the HL7 message you wish to retrieve the value for. e.g.

PID Identifies the PID Segment PID-3 Identifies the PID-3 Field PID-3.1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component PID-3.1.1 Identifies the PID-3.1.1 Subcomponent PID-3[2].1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component for second occurrence of the PID-3 Field
The new value to set the item to.

Only includes messages where a HL7 item equals a specific value. The format is: HL7Item=value. The HL7Item part of the filter is of the same format as the -ItemPosition parameter. The -Filter parameter accepts a list of filters (separated by a comma). If a list of filters is provided then a message must match all conditions to be included. e.g.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05 This filter would only include messages that had "ADT^A05" as the value for the MSH-9 field.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05,PV1-2=OUTPATIENT This filter would only include messages where both the MSH-9 field contained "ADT^A04" and the PV1-2 field contained "OUTPATIENT"
Update all occurrences identified by -ItemPosition
The value supplied by the '-Value' parameter is appended to the original value in the message (instead of replacing it).

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provide, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.
A string identifying the location of the item in the HL7 message you wish to retrieve the value for. e.g.

PID Identifies the PID Segment PID-3 Identifies the PID-3 Field PID-3.1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component PID-3.1.1 Identifies the PID-3.1.1 Subcomponent PID-3[2].1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component for second occurrence of the PID-3 Field
The new value to set the item to.

Only includes messages where a HL7 item equals a specific value. The format is: HL7Item=value. The HL7Item part of the filter is of the same format as the -ItemPosition parameter. The -Filter parameter accepts a list of filters (separated by a comma). If a list of filters is provided then a message must match all conditions to be included. e.g.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05 This filter would only include messages that had "ADT^A05" as the value for the MSH-9 field.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05,PV1-2=OUTPATIENT This filter would only include messages where both the MSH-9 field contained "ADT^A04" and the PV1-2 field contained "OUTPATIENT"
Update all occurrences identified by -ItemPosition
The value supplied by the '-Value' parameter is appended to the original value in the message (instead of replacing it).
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
A string identifying the location of the item in the HL7 message you wish to retrieve the value for. e.g.

PID Identifies the PID Segment PID-3 Identifies the PID-3 Field PID-3.1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component PID-3.1.1 Identifies the PID-3.1.1 Subcomponent PID-3[2].1 Identifies the PID-3.1 Component for second occurrence of the PID-3 Field
The new value to set the item to.

Only includes messages where a HL7 item equals a specific value. The format is: HL7Item=value. The HL7Item part of the filter is of the same format as the -ItemPosition parameter. The -Filter parameter accepts a list of filters (separated by a comma). If a list of filters is provided then a message must match all conditions to be included. e.g.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05 This filter would only include messages that had "ADT^A05" as the value for the MSH-9 field.
-Filter MSH-9=ADT^A05,PV1-2=OUTPATIENT This filter would only include messages where both the MSH-9 field contained "ADT^A04" and the PV1-2 field contained "OUTPATIENT"
Update all occurrences identified by -ItemPosition
The value supplied by the '-Value' parameter is appended to the original value in the message (instead of replacing it).

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provide, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.
List messages chronologically based on the header timestamp (MSH-7).
Lists messages chronologically based on the message header receive date/time field (MSH-7).
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
Switch to show messages in descending chronological order (defaults to ascending without this switch).

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provided, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.
Switch to show messages in descending chronological order (defaults to ascending without this switch).
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
Switch to show messages in descending chronological order (defaults to ascending without this switch).

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provided, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.
Split a batch file containing multiple messages into a separate file per message.
Splits a HL7 batch file into a separate file per HL7 message.
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
Switch to suppress warnings when overwriting existing files.

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provide, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.
Switch to suppress warnings when overwriting existing files.
Same as -Path, only wildcards are not expanded. Use this if the literal path includes a wildcard character you do not intent to expand.
Switch to suppress warnings when overwriting existing files.

The full or relative path a single HL7 file or directory. This may include wildcards in the path name. If a directory is provide, all files within the directory will be examined. Exceptions will be raised if a file isn't identified as a HL7 v2.x file. This parameter accepts a list of files, separate each file file with a ','.
